docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 19. -- The Inter-American Conference, having concluded agreements on the political items on its agenda, has turned its attention to economic questions, which means discussion of reduction of trade barriers and restoration of equal...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 19. -- The Inter-American Conference, having concluded agreements on the political items on its agenda, has turned its attention to economic questions, which means discussion of reduction of trade barriers and restoration of equal opportunity in international trade.
docs.abstract: Immediate change as result of Pan-Amer Peace Conf unlikely

headline.main: HULL TRADE POLICY MEETS OBSTACLES; South American Nations Reluctant to Give Up Exchange Controls Which Hamper Our Exports to Them

byline.original: By HAROLD B. HINTONSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges showed a firm undertone last week, a characteristic carried forward from the markets of the last several weeks. Business was on a fairly substantial scale throughout.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges showed a firm undertone last week, a characteristic carried forward from the markets of the last several weeks. Business was on a fairly substantial scale throughout.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED DEC. 19, 1936

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 23. -- A three-point formula for a definite settlement of the Chaco conflict will be formally presented to the Bolivian and Paraguayan Ministers for Foreign Affairs here tomorrow, under the auspices of the Inter-American Conference...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 23. -- A three-point formula for a definite settlement of the Chaco conflict will be formally presented to the Bolivian and Paraguayan Ministers for Foreign Affairs here tomorrow, under the auspices of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace.

headline.main: CHACO PLAN IS OUTLINED; Proposal Calls for Concessions by Both States Involved.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Americans who have not lived in South America are prone to read with mild astonishment that the early opposition apparent in the Buenos Aires Peace Conference to a complete divorcement of the nations of the Western Hemisphere from the League of...
docs.lead_paragraph: Americans who have not lived in South America are prone to read with mild astonishment that the early opposition apparent in the Buenos Aires Peace Conference to a complete divorcement of the nations of the Western Hemisphere from the League of Nations arises from strong ties that bind the peoples of the southern continent to the Old World.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA AND EUROPE; Old Ties Are Weakening in Our Favor, but Still Exist.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 26. All efforts to arrange some settlement of the Gran Chaco conflict between Bolivia and Paraguay under the auspices of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace have failed.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 26. All efforts to arrange some settlement of the Gran Chaco conflict between Bolivia and Paraguay under the auspices of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace have failed.

docs.snippet: I-Ioliday influences were plainly evident in the foreign exchange market last week. Business was at a minimum throughout and on Saturday, for instance, while the foreign markets were enjoying an added post-Christmas holiday, trading here was brought...
docs.lead_paragraph: I-Ioliday influences were plainly evident in the foreign exchange market last week. Business was at a minimum throughout and on Saturday, for instance, while the foreign markets were enjoying an added post-Christmas holiday, trading here was brought to a standstill and quotations we,'e purely nominal in character.
